00017 =head1 NAME
00018 
00019 contextRationalFunction.pl - Only allow rational functions
00020                              (and their products and powers)
00021 
00022 =head1 DESCRIPTION
00023 
00024 Implements a context in which students can only enter rational
00025 functions, with some control over whether a single division is
00026 allowed, or whether products of rational functions are allowed.
00027 
00028 Select the context using:
00029 
00030     Context("RationalFunction");
00031 
00032 The RationalFunction context supports all the flags of the
00033 PolynomialFactors context, except for strictDivision, since rational
00034 functions allow division of polynomials.
00035 
00036 In addition, there is a singleQuotients flag that controls whether
00037 products of rational functions are allowed or not.  By default, they
00038 are allowed, but you can set this flag to 1 in order to force the
00039 student answer to be as a single fraction.
00040 
00041 Finally, there is also a strict context that does not allow
00042 operations even within the coefficients.  Select it using:
00043 
00044     Context("RationalFunction-Strict");
00045 
00046 In addition to disallowing operations within the coefficients, this
00047 context does not reduce constant operations (since they are not
00048 allowed), and sets the singlePowers, singleFactors, singleQuotients,
00049 and stricPowers flags automatically.  In addition, it disables all the
00050 functions, though they can be re-enabled, if needed.
00051 
00052 =cut
00053 
00054 ##################################################
00055 
00056 loadMacros(
00057   "MathObjects.pl",
00058   "contextPolynomialFactors.pl"
00059 );
00060 
00061 sub _contextRationalFunction_init {RationalFunction::Init()}
00062 
00063 ##############################################
00064 
00065 package RationalFunction::BOP::multiply;
00066 our @ISA = qw(PolynomialFactors::BOP::multiply);
00067 
00068 sub checkFactors {
00069   my $self = shift; my ($l,$r) = @_;
00070   $self->SUPER::checkFactors($l,$r);
00071   if (($l->{isPoly}||0) >= 6 || ($r->{isPoly}||0) >= 6) {
00072     $self->Error("You can not use multiplication with rational functions as operands ".
00073                  "(do you need parentheses around the denominator?)")
00074       if $self->context->flag("singleQuotients");
00075     $self->{isPoly} = 7; # product containing rational functions
00076   }
00077   return 1;
00078 }
00079 
00080 ##############################################
00081 
00082 package RationalFunction::BOP::divide;
00083 our @ISA = qw(PolynomialFactors::BOP::divide);
00084 
00085 sub checkPolynomial {
00086   my $self = shift; my ($l,$r) = ($self->{lop},$self->{rop});
00087   if ((!$l->{isPoly} || $l->{isPoly} == 2) && LimitedPolynomial::isConstant($r)) {
00088     $self->{isPoly} = $l->{isPoly};
00089     $self->{powers} = $l->{powers}; delete $l->{powers};
00090     $self->{exponents} = $l->{exponents}; delete $l->{exponents};
00091   } elsif (($l->{isPoly}||0) >= 6 || ($r->{isPoly}||0) >= 6) {
00092     $self->Error("Only one polynomial division is allowed in a rational function");
00093   } else {
00094     PolynomialFactors::markFactor($l);
00095     PolynomialFactors::markFactor($r);
00096     $self->checkFactors($l,$r);
00097   }
00098   return 1;
00099 }
00100 
00101 sub checkFactors {
00102   my $self = shift; my ($l,$r) = @_;
00103   my $single = $self->context->flag("singleFactors");
00104   $self->Error("Only one constant multiple or fraction is allowed (combine or cancel them)")
00105     if $l->{factors}{0} && $r->{factors}{0} && $self->context->flag("singleFactors");
00106   $self->{factors} = $l->{factors}; delete $l->{factors};
00107   foreach my $factor (keys %{$r->{factors}}) {
00108     if ($single && $self->{factors}{$factor}) {
00109       $self->Error("Each factor can appear only once (combine or cancel like factors)") unless $factor eq "0";
00110       $self->Error("Only one constant coefficient or negation is allowed (combine or cancel them)");
00111     }
00112     $self->{factors}{$factor} = 1;
00113   }
00114   delete $r->{factors};
00115   $self->{isPoly} = 6; # rational function
00116   return 1;
00117 }
00118 
00119 ##############################################
00120 
00121 package RationalFunction::BOP::power;
00122 our @ISA = qw(PolynomialFactors::BOP::power);
00123 
00124 sub checkPolynomial {
00125   my $self = shift; my ($l,$r) = ($self->{lop},$self->{rop});
00126   $self->SUPER::checkPolynomial;
00127   $self->{isPoly} = 6 if ($l->{isPoly}||0) >= 6;
00128   return 1;
00129 }
00130 
00131 ##############################################
00132 
00133 package RationalFunction::UOP::minus;
00134 our @ISA = qw(PolynomialFactors::UOP::minus);
00135 
00136 sub checkPolynomial {
00137   my $self = shift;
00138   $self->SUPER::checkPolynomial;
00139   $self->{isPoly} = 6 if ($self->{op}{isPoly}||0) >= 6;
00140   return 1;
00141 }

00143 ##############################################
00144 
00145 package RationalFunction;
00146 our @ISA = ('PolynomialFactors');
00147 
00148 sub Init {
00149   #
00150   #  Build the new context that calls the
00151   #  above classes rather than the usual ones
00152   #
00153 
00154   my $context = $main::context{RationalFunction} = Parser::Context->getCopy("PolynomialFactors");
00155   $context->{name} = "RationalFunction";
00156   $context->operators->set(
00157      '*' => {class => 'RationalFunction::BOP::multiply'},
00158     '* ' => {class => 'RationalFunction::BOP::multiply'},
00159     ' *' => {class => 'RationalFunction::BOP::multiply'},
00160      ' ' => {class => 'RationalFunction::BOP::multiply'},
00161      '/' => {class => 'RationalFunction::BOP::divide'},
00162     ' /' => {class => 'RationalFunction::BOP::divide'},
00163     '/ ' => {class => 'RationalFunction::BOP::divide'},
00164      '^' => {class => 'RationalFunction::BOP::power'},
00165     '**' => {class => 'RationalFunction::BOP::power'},
00166     'u-' => {class => 'RationalFunction::UOP::minus'},
00167   );
00168   $context->flags->set(strictPowers => 1);
00169 
00170   #
00171   #  A context where coefficients can't include operations
00172   #
00173   $context = $main::context{"RationalFunction-Strict"} = $context->copy;
00174   $context->flags->set(
00175     strictCoefficients => 1,
00176     singlePowers => 1, singleFactors => 1, singleQuotients => 1,
00177     reduceConstants => 0,
00178   );
00179   $context->functions->disable("All");  # can be re-enabled if needed
00180 
00181   main::Context("RationalFunction");  ### FIXME:  probably should require author to set this explicitly
00182 }
00183 
00184 1;
